newsitem.title: USA: Persistence Software in Morgan Stanley deal.
newsitem.headline: Persistence Software in Morgan Stanley deal.

text.p: Persistence Software Inc said on Monday it signed a $3.65 million agreement with Morgan Stanley & Co Inc to use Persistence technology in the investment bank's computer systems for trading, portfolio management and risk management.
The Persistence Live Object Cache technology will be used in computer systems by Morgan Stanley traders and salesmen worldwide, the software company said.
As part of the deal, Persistence will license Morgan Stanley's Object Filter event-notification technology, and incorporate it into future product releases.
Persistence, based in San Mateo, Calif., provides products for companies building large-scale systems that must access existing business data stored in interrelated databases.
